metadata.original_query:
- Show me the latest innovations in Weatherability of Decorative Coatings.
- What trends are emerging in the Sustainability of industrial coatings in 2025?
- Find recent conferences or Patentss discussing Scuff-Resistance in coatings.

1. Search tags/topics - Product, coating, architectural or similar.
2. Datasources/URLs (https://www.paint.org/, https://www.coatingsworld.com/, https://www.pcimag.com/)

News.title: ABRAFATI 2017: COATEX and ACR Reveals its Latest Developments
News.summary: Coatex Latam Sales and Technical teams have selected topics of interest to be introduced to the market and welcome attendees at the Arkema booth #8 for technical discussions and exchanges. Continuously innovating and developing new additives to fulfill even more demanding constraints and requirements, Coatex shares its new technical findings.

News.title: Sherwin-Williams Protective & Marine Launches FIRETEX M90/03
News.summary: Passive fire protection for onshore assets mitigates hydrocarbon pool fire and corrosion risks. Sherwin-Williams Protective & Marine expanded its line of FIRETEX passive fire protection coatings with a solution that optimizes applications and reduces costs by enabling precise coating thickness specifications for onshore assets.

Patents.title: Renovations, DIY Drive Growth In Architectural Coatings Market
Patents.summary: Leading coatings manufacturers are observing increased interest in DIY projects and home renovations, which are becoming the primary drivers of growth in the architectural coatings market, as opposed to new construction. The article discusses the resilience of the market, influenced by housing trends and consumer interest in home improvement. Key industry players and experts highlight sustainability, low-VOC products, and color trends as significant factors for 2025, with an overall expectation of modest growth in the upcoming year. [1]

Patents.title: Latest Developments in the UK Coatings Sector
Patents.summary: The article discusses recent advancements and activities within the UK coatings industry, with a strong emphasis on sustainability and environmental performance. Key highlights include a research partnership between AkzoNobel and the University of Manchester using AI to develop more durable and sustainable coatings. The piece also covers the British Coatings Federation's (BCF) 'Coatings Care' report, noting significant improvements in health, safety, and environmental (HSE) metrics, such as record-low energy use per tonne of production and a majority of sites reporting zero landfill waste. Lastly, it mentions the announcement of 'Crocky Road' as the 2025 Color of the Year by UK-based Earthborn Paints.

Patents.title: Growth and Use of Radiation-Curing Technology in China
Patents.summary: This article, from October 2005, details the expansion of radiation-curing technology in China, corresponding with the country's economic growth. It reviews data from 109 companies, including raw material producers, UV product manufacturers, and equipment suppliers, noting significant growth rates in production value and output. The paper also touches upon research advancements, such as the development of hyperbranched oligomers and UV-curable powder coatings, and discusses market trends and future potential, particularly in light of events like the 2008 Summer Olympics.

Conference.title: American Coatings CONFERENCE: Recognizing Industry Innovations
Conference.summary: The 2016 American Coatings CONFERENCE, held from April 11–13, provided a platform for educational opportunities with 96 technical presentations under the theme “Designing Innovation Strategies for the Future.” The event featured pre-conference tutorials, a plenary session with a keynote by Dr. Sharon Feng, and the presentation of several awards. The Roon Foundation Awards recognized top technical papers, with first place going to a team from North Dakota State University. The American Coatings AWARD for the most impactful paper was presented to Dow Chemical for their work on “Near-Zero VOC Waterborne Alkyd Dispersions with Solventborne Alkyd Performance.” The conference also included the Mattiello Memorial Lecture delivered by Donald C. Sundberg and a poster session for researchers to display their work.

Conference.title: 2023 CoatingsTech Conference Highlights
Conference.summary: A summary of the ACA's 2023 CoatingsTech Conference, which took place in Cleveland, Ohio, from June 26-28. The theme was “Coatings Technologies: Adaptation in a Complex World,” and the event included specialized lectures, technical sessions, and networking opportunities.

Conference.title: Keynote Address: Developing Coatings for a More Sustainable Future
Conference.summary: Dr. John A. Gilbert, Chief Research and Development Officer at Behr Process Corporation, delivered the keynote address. He discussed recent advances in coatings formulation that provide sustainable choices for the end user, including advanced waterborne formulations and lower carbon footprint strategies.

Conference.title: Mattiello Award Lecture: Visualizing How Coatings 'Fail' – Service Life Viewed through the Lenses of Coatings Science
Conference.summary: Dr. Kurt Wood, retired senior principal scientist at Arkema, Inc., delivered the Mattiello Award Lecture. His lecture focused on using simple chemical, physical, and mechanical models to understand the essential elements of coating systems and identify ways to extend their service life.

Conference.title: CoatingsTech Best Paper Award: Thermally, UV, and Moisture Curable Novel Family of Versatile Oligomers
Conference.summary: Tahereh (Neda) Hayeri, a Ph.D. candidate at Eastern Michigan University, received the Best Paper Award for her research on a new family of oligomers that can be cured by multiple methods (thermal, UV, and moisture). This innovation addresses challenges in conventional UV-cure systems.

Conference.title: Inaugural David F. Darling Prize
Conference.summary: The first-ever David F. Darling Prize was awarded to Dr. Dane R. Jones for his contributions to sustainability and environmental stewardship in coatings science. His work includes inventing new VOC analysis methods and developing ASTM standards for architectural coatings.
